OPEN SOLUTIONS CANADA

Programmer/Analyst


Job ID # 863448
Job Location Canada-Ontario-Oakville
Job Stream Information Technology
Job Type Permanent, Full-Time
Salary/Rate Open
Number of Positions Open 1
Start Date of Employment ASAP
Posting Date 09-Aug-2007
Travel Required Occasionally
Educational Requirements N/A
Languages Required English


Job Description
Reporting to the Manger Development Services, the Programmer is responsible for writing, testing, analysis, implementation, and support of reports/applications for the Product Development and Support family of products.

Specific responsibilities in this role include:

Develop and support systems using current technologies as required according to specifications.
The incumbent will develop new reports/programs, according to department standards and architecture, as described in project definition documents or business requirements documents.
Responsible for assigned development items as per Incident Reports within predefined response and delivery times.
Will perform functional, unit, and systems integration testing prior to hand-over to the Quality Assurance group.
Will assist in the design of new products and systems, under the guidance of more senior Programmer Analysts and/or the Chief Developer.
Will analyze existing systems for functional gaps and enhancements with the objective of providing recommendations to more senior Programmer Analysts and/or the Chief Developer.
Will input as requested to project definition documents and business requirements documents for the analysis and design of systems.
May be responsible for internal and external installation and training duties as required.
May be required to travel to customer sites.
May be called upon for 7/24 functions.
Will respond to, investigate, and resolve production problems.
The ideal candidate will possess the following education, skills and traits:

Community College or higher, specializing in Computer Science related studies, with at least four years of work experience.
An excellent understanding of Crystal Reports, and relational databases including DB2, SQL, and Oracle.
Working knowledge of VB and C++ is preferred.
Good analytical, problem solving, and fault isolation skills.
Possesses effective written and oral communication skills.
An understanding of the payments industry and self-service financial products, switching, monitoring, transaction processing, and settlement and reconciliation would be beneficial.
Experience following development processes and methodologies, and familiarity with all phases of the software development life cycle.
Must be able to communicate ideas and concepts to all parties.
